product_name: Vita Coco Coconut Water, Lemonade - Naturally Hydrating Electrolyte Drink - Smart Alternative to Coffee, Soda, and Sports Drinks - Gluten Free - 11.1 Ounce (Pack of 12)Vita Coco Organic Coconut Water, Pure - Naturally Hydrating Electrolyte Drink - Smart...Vita Coco Sparkling Coconut Water, Lemon Ginger - Low Calorie Naturally Hydrating...Vita Coco Organic Coconut Water, Pure - Naturally Hydrating Electrolyte Drink - Smart...Vita Coco Coconut Water, Pineapple - Naturally Hydrating Electrolyte Drink - Smart...Vita Coco Coconut Water, Pineapple - Naturally Hydrating Electrolyte Drink - Smart...

reviews.review_text: These are delicious! My 4 year old loves them! They have a few different flavors but the pineapple is the best. With the kids involved in so many activities these are a really good at hydrating them. These are also much better cold, try them after they are in the fridge for a while. Will buy again!
reviews.review_header: Best flavor! Very good, even the kids love them!

reviews.review_text: These are delicious and refreshing. The pineapple taste pretty much takes over though so you can barely taste the coconut. I like pineapple so i can't complain.
reviews.review_header: The pineapple taste pretty much takes over though so you can barely taste ...

reviews.review_text: Delicious ! A Sweet Delight ! Want It All ! Thanks Again Amazon ! A Number Two Helper ?? Pacing One Self ? Loving It !

These drinks are good, but the package I received has a carton smashed and had leaked all over the packaging. So I lost one whole carton of drink. 3 stars is for the packaging more than the drink itself.

If you're like me you really enjoy the all around effects of vita coco but you're not really keen on the taste then I suggest you try another flavor this one tastes really similar to the original. This stuff pretty much tastes exactly like the original flavor with a slight hint of peach and mango but no real flavor. If like me you're looking for some stuff that tastes better than the original I highly suggest getting the pineapple flavor (pretty much tastes like a watered down pina colada)
reviews.review_header: Only buy if you really like the original flavor

reviews.review_text: Love that it has variety and then if you like one flavor more than the other then you can just order that flavor.
Be aware that these are 11.1 fl oz and not the 16.8 fl oz that theses typically come in from the store.

I use this the rehydrate with. I love it as and alternative to water. I don't know how much sugar it has, but its not overly sweet. It has a great taste. Only thing I don't like, and this is more a complaint to the Tetra Paks is you may *think* you have more beverage but it wont come out. I think it kinda get stuck in the folds or cant make it through the small opening at the top.

This is simply a clean, super tasty beverage. No added sugars. Just good coconut water with pineapple. It comes in the perfect package size, and has only 80 calories per container. A great beverage that anybody can enjoy. One further note: coconut water can be an inaccessible flavor for some people....the pineapple really brings it together and makes it palatable for peeps who would otherwise turn their nose up at the coconut flavor. Enjoy!
Excellent beverage, I drink it everyday to maintain a balance of electrolites as I work long hours and enjoy good health!
It take much better than regular coconut water!
The awesome vita coco with a twist. Very refreshing. It tastes best ice cold!
Really love this>plain or in smoothies. The colder ,the better it tastes

The person that said there is no Pineapple in the Pineapple flavored Coconut water is probably eating something super sweet b4 drinking it. AMAZINGLY WONDERFUL. I was lovin the plain. The I tried the pineapple and it was so good I went out and bought a bottle of Knudsons Organic Pineapple juice to blend with my 12 Liters of plain I bought. But the Pineapple blend direct from Vita Coco is the absolute BEST.
reviews.review_header: WOW EXcellent Taste Not too sweet but wonderful

reviews.review_text: An excellent refreshing pick me up - especially after exercising. It is best served over ice. I tried it as a mixer for an alcoholic drink and it totally did not work. The fruit flavor is light versus heavy and the coconut flavor really comes through even though this is coconut "water" versus the heavier coconut "milk". The one downside is the package comes with no straw so you must have a sharp clean object handy to penetrate the seal.
reviews.review_header: excellent fruit and coconut beverage for those who love both

reviews.review_text: My hubby hated it. I loved it. More for me. ;)

I got hooked on VitaCoco buying it on accident once and it is delicious. I like the Peach Mango flavor the best. On my vacation to the Caribbean Islands I got to try different ideas from the natives and found that green coconut water was good for hangovers and brown coconut water was good for constipation. Well VitaCoco falls into the hangover category. In fact I find that using VitaCoco as an alcohol mixer works great to balance out the equation.
Cheaper than getting it at Sam's. LOVE the taste.
This stuff is awesome. I'd buy it on auto-renew if I were made of money.
A lifesaver for my brother. Really helps hydrate.

Love This! I’ve bought this multiple times from Amazon, and every time the item has arrived fully sealed up and in its own box for added safety. I Will continue to purchase this from amazon, Some might find the taste a little too sweet and I would agree, so I highly recommend adding a pinch of Pink Himalayan Salt To each bottle before drinking it, I find it balances out the flavors quite nicely and it taste amazing.

I have tried a few different brands of coconut water and this is by far my favorite. Anyone that's disappointed in the flavor has probably never tried coconut water before, as it has a VERY faint flavor. You should not expect this to taste like a sugary juice. This particular brand, the pineapple version specifically, is the most flavorful (and delicious) kind that I've tried. It's definitely best when very cold, so wait for it to chill before you drink it! I had to put this on subscription!

First time having this flavor. It’s really good. I like it more than the pineapple I usually get. I haven’t found this size container in stores lately. Happy to find this here. Good for a post workout refuel.

I like this. I was not so impressed with it at first but I shook it well and mixed half a carton ..just over 5oz into my flavored vitamin water and. .bam..can taste the pineapple..I love it and will be using it regularly
reviews.review_author: Dawn B paraplegic since 85' just trying to roll with the punches

reviews.review_text: Delicious, lots of potassium to keep you hydrated, tastes great with the pineapple flavor that gives the coconut taste more of a tang. I like these smaller portable sized containers, though they create more waste.
reviews.review_header: tastes great with the pineapple flavor that gives the coconut taste ...

reviews.review_text: I think I taste more of the mango then the peach but over all I like the Vita Coco water with flavors then just by itself. I am not in the food science world but I think Coconut water is made by taking the coconut milk and separating the cream/ solids from the water part. What is left is a strong coconut flavored past that is sent somewhere else and coconut water that still has health effects and a very slight coconut flavor. It also has some weight, or thickness that is heaver then what normal water would be, it reminds me of an egg white viscosity. Drink it colder the better I say because when warm urp!
Simply delicious. A great way to beat your thirst and get the electrolytes you need at the same tiem.

I like most of the products by vita-coco. However, I do not like the taste of this at all. Very bitter. It tastes just like lemon juice concentrate from one of those plastic lemon juice bottles mixed with coconut water. Not sweet at all. Just bitter. These flavors do not mix well. I'm sticking with the pineapple flavor.

I find plain coconut water to be a little unpalatable. It's an acquired taste that I have a hard time acquiring. With pineapple, I absolutely adore it. It only adds about 15g of sugar (so, two teaspoons, not too bad) but makes the taste really really enjoyable. When I do use coconut water I have a lot less soreness after my lifting sessions. I also just -feel- better. I strongly recommend this product to anyone who is active and may have tried coconut water in the past only to make a face and pass it on to someone else. Plus, the price per unit is marvelous on Amazon.

I feel like straight coconut water is an acquired taste, but these peach mango ones are just delicious. They aren't too sweet and the mix of peach and mango is more of an accent than a dominant set of flavors. The result is a cool, refreshing beverage in what i consider to be the perfect container size. Where i live, these are priced individually at an average of $1.79, which would be around $21.50 for a twelve pack. So, for the current subscribe & save price of $17.65, you are saving around $4 here on Amazon (if you would have purchased twelve anyway that is). Great taste, competitive price. I am glad to have found these here.
These are my favorite, but I don’t buy them much because they’re pricy. Can’t drink too many at once or it gives me an upset stomach.
Taste great! I don’t like the taste of Regular coconut water. This hits the spot. It’s a little tart, but it’s delicious. I will definitely buy again

Tasted okay, but the mixture of lemonade and coconut water is "special". Not sure if it's due to their expirations, I didn't realize it until had a few bottles. I bought it as a subscription. It arrived on May 28, 2017 and the best to use date printed on box is May 24, 2017.
reviews.review_header: 2017 and the best to use date printed on box is May 24

reviews.review_text: I like regular Coconut water, but I don't love it. This flavor is very sweet so it tastes a million times better and I love it. Even people who HATE coconut water (they usually say it tastes like dirty water) have told me this one isn't bad and some have even really liked it. I don't like drinking water so this is a really good alternative for me.
If you aren't wild about coconut water but still want the benefit then I highly recommend this. It is delicious!! I loved it!! Now I need to order more!!

I normally use these after my Bikram yoga class but they are great after any workout. They are a bit high in calories so I try to limit to after a tough workout but they taste great and I highly recommend them. HOWEVER, they have sent me new bottles that drip everywhere because the top where you drink has a change to it. Horrible. Half my drink spills/leaks on the floor before I get it to my mouth. I cancelled my membership because I refuse to pay for a product that has dysfunctional packaging.
reviews.review_header: Cancelled Subscription Because of Packaging Change

reviews.review_text: So great for hydration for those who are athletic and need a healthy alternative to sugary "electrolyte" drinks...you know what I am talking about. :-) My only complaint is that I cannot drink the plain coconut water by itself due to the flavor, so it goes into pancake mix or protein smoothies as it takes on the flavor of what it is mixed with. Happy hydration!

This tastes like a very watery pina colada, which, after a workout and you need to rehydrate, is a good thing. Children probably wouldn't like it, mine don't, but I do like a nice cold Coconut Water after working out. I don't like bananas, which is the way a lot of people get their potassium, so I drink one of these each day to get some of what I'm lacking. My only complaint is that I wish it came with a straw attached like most juice boxes do. You can peel of the silver sticker on the top to expose the opening, but I would prefer a straw.
reviews.review_header: I don't like bananas, so I drink this for potassium

reviews.review_text: The first carton was kinda what I expected but after that, I was able to drink them frequently. I would order again. I like them. I crave them now.
reviews.review_header: I like them. I crave them now

reviews.review_text: Delicious! Refreshing. So glad that Amazon carries the variety pack. Love it! Definitely will buy again.
reviews.review_header: So glad that Amazon carries the variety pack

reviews.review_text: I love this brand of coconut water and was excited to find them on here in the multi pack. My excitement ended when I received my order and EVERY single last one of them were EXPIRED!!! Unacceptable!!! As u can see in the picture I attached, some even say Dec 2015...I received them today on FEBRUARY 10th!!!

I have purchased Vita Coco Coconut Water multiple times. I have never been anything but completely satisfied with the taste, consistency and quality of this product. Vita Coco brand is a brand that I can trust. I know that when I buy items from this company I am going to get a good quality product in good packaging that tastes amazing. Coconut water is a great addition to a healthy diet. It provides many key nutrients and helps keep the body hydrated. My remarks are my experience with the product. Your experience with the product may vary, however I aim to provide a honest review of the product. I hope that this review helped you. If it did please kindly check the box that states that it was helpful.
reviews.review_header: Coconut water is a great addition to a healthy diet. It provides many key nutrients and helps keep the body hydrated.

reviews.review_text: I love this brand of coconut water! The pineapple coconut water is my absolute favorite! I drink one almost every morning. I also love the 11 oz packages they are the perfect size for me, the 16 oz boxes are a little too much for me. Unfortunately one of my containers had a puncture in the inner lining. The coconut water saturated the box material and molded. I didn't realize until I had taken a huge swig that the product had gone bad. So I would be extra careful and check all of your containers, but other than that it is a wonderful product.

Wow you either love or hate this product...I love it...but I had to play with it to find the right way to drink it, you may wonder what that means. Well I love peach & mango drinks & love coconut water anyway....but this product has to be VERY VERY cold to be at its best or it taste like a pasty product. I find that if you let it get just a bit frozen like a soft slurpee/slushee it is really good or just very very cold will work. I have seen some ppl post very negative remarks on here & think some may be exaggerating just a bit & some may not really know what to expect from a drink like this...nothing wrong with that just dont be so dramatic about it really. One thing I have found a GREAT use for this with is Jamba Juice now sells frozen packs of it tops selling smoothies in stores now, so I like to buy my favorite Mango a go go & use the mango/peach coconut juice to blend the smoothie instead of using the apple juice that it calls for...you could use any of the vita water favors to mix with any of the flavors. Instead of hating something try mixing it with something else & finding ways to create a healthy drink. Bottom line I love it.

Can anyone really say anything bad about coconut water? In addition to all of the health benefits, this one has pineapple- which is a natural remedy for a sore throat. I always try to keep a few of these on hand to help with coughing fits during a cold. Even when healthy, this is just delicious! The packaging was from Amazon, so it was excellent as always and arrived with Prime 2 day shipping. I will definitely purchase again!

I bought this because I thought that putting Peach and Mango may be good and I would be buying it again. Boy how wrong was I to think that. I would never, ever buy this again. The taste is beyond awful. I gave it one star would have given it 0 stars if I could. My friends and two family members all said the same thing that I did. They either put the cap back on it and threw it in the trash or they poured it down the drain and threw the container away. And this was after just one sip of this coconut water. If you buy this after my review of how bad this coconut water taste then I would say that your taste buds are messed up. ( the coconut water with pineapple was way, way better).

I grew up in the tropics and had a lot of coconut water and mangos while growing up. I was excited to get this version of Vita's excellent coconut water. I opened one of the containers and took a swig immediately as I opened the box. Ugh! The mango aftertaste in this drink is the worst of the different mango flavors. It overpowers both the coconut and peach flavors. I can't even taste the peach in the drink. I let it chill to see if the aftertaste would go away, but was not so lucky. The flavor that overpowers everything is what you get when you leave the peeled mango out in the open for a day or two. It's way past ripe going to starting to get rancid. I put several other containers in the fridge to chill. I got the same results. It's a bummer because I was looking forward to drinking it. The version with pineapple is much much better than this one. I still like the straight coconut water drink the best. It tastes just like the fresh coconuts that my family used to cut down from the palms and drink with a straw.

This is my favorite brand of coconut water. Despite some negative reviews, I've fortunately never had a problem, nor been disappointed in the taste or quality. I'm not one to buy into the hype surrounding certain products, but I must admit that all of the positive things I've heard about coconut water have held true for me. Maybe the most noticeable thing is how much more "hydrated" I feel after drinking it. I work 12 hour shifts as an RN and this really helps as I often am too busy to drink as much as I should. I've replaced most of my other juices with this, and I also love using it to make smoothies.

Coconut water usually tastes disgusting, but when you throw in pineapple, it is reeeeally tasty. If you need to drink coconut water, and you hate the regular stuff (like me), definitely try this - you will be pleasantly surprised with how well it tastes. This is still 100% natural, and doesn't have additional "natural" flavors added to it.

I came on here to review the coconut water lemonade and found others who received expired stuff. I checked, hoping that was the issue, but mine didn't expire for a few more months. Now I can say with certainty, this is disgusting. It was too tart and not a very good combination of the two flavors. The only time the flavor was tolerable was when I mixed it with coconut rum. That was pretty tasty, but I bought it so I could drink throughout the day, not so the only way I can drink it was with alcohol.
love this flavor!!!

A rather disappointing product. Quite flavorless with no discernible coconut flavor at all. A weak pineapple flavor is all I tasted. So disappointing, that I have no desire to try another Pak. I'll probably just give away the other 11 tetra paks in the case, in the hope that someone else likes this product. I was tempted to give it a one star rating, but I'll reserve that for something really awful. This was merely tasteless and disappointing.
I am not sure if my batch was bad, but this tastes nasty. There is no Pineapple flavor to it at all. I have had coconut water in the past and it never tasted like this.
Awesome recovery drink post workout... love the tropical fruity flavor

I have tried numerous coconut waters... check their ingredients. While some use lots of ingredients or additives, this one is pure and very tasty especially with their options of other fruits. Only others I enjoy have a little sugar and small coconut bits in them which is pretty decent but not as flavorful as vita coco.
reviews.review_header: One of the best Coconut waters

reviews.review_text: I buy Vita Coco Coconut Water LEMONADE flavor for my 86 yr old mother. Mom has some health issues and needs to stay hydrated, don't we all? Her favorite flavor (the only one she'll drink regularly) is lemonade and it's not always available in local stores so being able to order it for her here is perfect.
Yummy when cold.

Delicious coconut water - although, the Mango flavor is slightly bitter/sour. I like that these aren't loaded with sugar and are reasonable in calories. Great way to hydrate when out at the beach or on the boat - even after a workout. Love it!
I’m love is

I have been drinking coconut water for about six months and had a hard time finding the right one. I needed a smaller package so I could monitor how much I am drinking during the day. This product is perfect. Just the right size and the price is great. I even signed up for auto delivery. Great idea - now I will not run out of this wonderful alternative to soda!!
My son loves these, but I guess I didn't look at the description well enough. I thought that these were the larger size. That's my only complaint. They arrived on time.
reviews.review_header: Good buy but they're the smaller size.

reviews.review_text: I drink one or two of these every day. They quench my thirst better than water and give me energy as well. The flavor is amazing.

I love this stuff! The package arrived very quickly as usual with Amazon shipments. I was a little apprehensive about ordering these from Amazon because of comments that the product tasted sour or spoiled. I would say only one out of the case tasted sour, the others were fine; that may have been because it wasn't as cold as I am used to. I will order these again from Amazon.
I love these they are excellent for hydration and this flavor is to me the best one. I use one each day.

This isn't something you drink for pleasure - at least I don't. I drink it because it's supposed to be good for me, and because I'm trying to cut out soda. The peach & mango is way better than the plain or the tropical, but it's still not something I can honestly say I enjoy. I'll keep drinking it though, because I keep reading things that say it will do me good, and I don't want to keep drinking soda like I do. It's better to drink this when it's really cold, and it's easier if you drink it really fast.

Love the convenience of having these babies delivered to my doorstep via the Amazon stork. The problem, as you can see above, is the price. The 11.1-ounce container will last you about 3 gulps, especially after a long run, tennis match, etc., so I always have to caution myself not to drink two dollars away in two seconds when I'm too thirsty. Um, but should I really have to do that? Maybe I'm too poor (cheap). The truly annoying part about the price is that it fluctuates dramatically. I've paid as low as $13, and as high as $20, and guess what? It's just not very exciting to pay the $20 after getting it for $13. $20 is a reasonably good deal for the 16-ounce size, but too much for these gulp-unfriendly versions.
This project was expired by a month when it was received.

The package I received expires just a few days from now which is disappointing that nobody caught that before shipping it out to a customer. The customer service representative was amazing and is having another box overnighted to me to replace these. I love the actual product thou, they are wonderful!
reviews.review_header: Product almost out of date when recieved, customer service was great with correcting mistake

reviews.review_text: Very good product but box came damaged which had nothing to do with the product. Somehow one of the cartons got slit opened, prob at the post office n the delivery box was mushy wet. I reported it and Amazon made good on the problem. I think this item is fairly priced n I like that it is harvested from India. I only wish it was organic.

I wanted to get on the Coconut water band wagon as its a healthy drink and when I go out and party a little too hard, it helps the hangover. I didn't like the taste of regular coconut water and thought id give the lemonade flavor a try. It tastes great.
The combination of coconut water with the hint of pineapple is delicious!

Of course I had to jump on the coconut bandwagon but just don’t like the plain stuff. I keep these on hand at all times. They are really refreshing after a workout. They are also good for when someone is sick. Definitely helps you feel better.
i love the products of vita coco cocont water. peach mango is the best flavor. good price
BEST flavor of coconut water!
My daughter loves these after practice!

These convenient tetra paks of Vita ("life" in Italian) Coco Coconut Water WITH Pineapple is a smart and easy way to rehydrate! I lose a lot of electrolytes (sodium and potassium) and this little pak is "paked" with them! I used to drink Gatorade for the same purpose of hydrating, and they took up a lot of space inside my refrigerator. But not these! I just bought two boxes of these and am now ready to buy two more!!!
reviews.review_header: Hydration Never Tasted and Felt so Good!

reviews.review_text: I don't like it but my husband loves it. Coconut water is gross to me. I can only drink the chocolate kind. I love coconut flavor. Makes me feel good though obviously healthy lots of potassium. Helps with charlie horse problems because of that.
Vita Coconut Water is delicious in all flavors including the unflavored Coconut water hydrates and provides Incredible health benefits!
Excelente, refrescante y riquísima.

As I mentioned in my review for Vitacoco's coconut water with acai & pomegranate, I recently discovered this product at a local market and enjoyed it as a way to rehydrate after a hot day on the golf course. According to the label, coconut water has more potassium than a banana and of all the flavors, the pineapple is easily my favorite. Found it for a good price on Amazon and ordered it by the case. It shipped quickly and without problem. Will definitely be buying again...
reviews.review_header: Best coconut water on the market...

reviews.review_text: I love that coconut water!! Love that it isn't from concentrate! Love that is pineapple! Love that is cheaper than my local Walmart! Buy it!
Really didn't like this. So sour! Nothing like lemonade. It was bad enough that we tried it and poured the rest out immediately.

I HATE coconut water. With that said, this flavor it amazing. You can't taste the coconut water, it just taste good. I have problems with low potassium so I have to drink coconut water and keep track of my daily potassium intake. Drinking this makes it much easier for me to ensure I have had enough potassium. This stuff is really good. The lemonade is ok. The pineapple is amazing!
reviews.review_header: You can't tell you're drinking coconut water. Its just good.

reviews.review_text: Very refreshing! Must drink cold! Great water supplement for when I get bored of drinking regular water! Pineapple flavor is very subtle. Will definitely buy again!

I got this during a Gold Box deal, but the price is good even without that deal. I found that I was drinking a lot of VitaCoco and it was more cost effective to order a 12-pack online than keep buying single ones. I didn't like other coconut water brands/flavors that I tried, but the pineapple flavor is actually super yummy! It's refreshing and gives it just the right amount of tartness to balance out the sweetness of the coconut.
I have really tried to cut back on my consumption of soft drinks and substitute for more H2O. These are a nice change of pace from regular coconut water with two different flavors.
reviews.review_header: These are a nice change of pace from regular coconut water with two ...

reviews.review_text: I'm trying to make some healthy choices and coconut water over soda is one of them, but they sure don't make it easy. This stuff isn't good. Actually, it's rather yucky, but it's healthier than pop/soda, so I'm committed. The pineapple is probably the best I've tasted, but that's not saying much. I love pineapple and this stuff almost makes me hate it, but not quite. I will keep drinking it though, because I don't like what soda does to me. I just wish this stuff would start to grow on me, and soon!

Drinking fresh coconut water is commonplace in Miami, where growing up, you could easily find roadside vendors selling "Coco Frio". They take a coconut, give it a couple of well-placed cuts with a machete to cut open a small notch on one end, insert a straw, and bingo! You're enjoying a great, natural, and healthy drink. This product is probably the closest you'll get to duplicating that fresh taste, plus it has the additional benefit of mango & peach puree giving it an additional flavor boost. Plus, it's got electrolytes.
reviews.review_header: Almost as good as fresh Coco Frio

reviews.review_text: As with any type of food, I guess, whether you like it or not is a matter of taste. I enjoy the taste of this drink, but I think I would not have when I was a child or a teen, but my taste buds then liked heavily processed foods and beverages that were full of sugar and/or artificial ingredients. Over the years I have come to enjoy eating and drinking more healthy foods that are not always the one that can be found at a convenience store or at a fast food place. Anyway, the one factor that surprised me is that even though the drinks come in a juice box type container that even has writing on it that says "it is like sticking a straw in a coconut," yet there are no attached straws. Anyway, one more positive comment is that that shipping was very fast.

Consciously, I feel very healthy when I drink Vita Coco. I drink 1/2 container every day and it seems to help with aches and pains and head aches. This isn't one of my favorite flavors but I like it. The only problem that I have with it (and I used to use auto ship) is that the price keeps increasing. Also, I wish the shippers would make up their mind. Sometimes it ships in the manufacturers box and sometimes they put it into another box. Save money, just ship in the box from the manufacturer.

It is so light and refreshing. Instead of reaching for a sports drink after a long, sweaty day of work in the heat, I grab a cold one of these. Has to be the pineapple flavor. The other fruity ones are very meh. And plain coconut water is pretty yuck. But the pineapple is a home run! We also give to our toddler instead of Pedialyte!
reviews.review_header: So refreshing. Be sure to chill it!

reviews.review_text: Addictive! Without the pineapple, it tastes like stinky sweat socks. With pineapple, very delicious! I can’t get enough of this stuff!
reviews.review_header: it tastes like stinky sweat socks

reviews.review_text: Mold , huge clumps of mold fell out as I opened and began to pour one. I still had 5 months b4 expiration. Date.mim sure amazon will replace but I question the product quality.

I love this! It Is alittle sugary and tart. I like to mix it with pure coconut water if the same brand. It taste great! This is also a great brand that isn't from concentrate and in my research they do use a medium temp for pasteurize for 5 sec. Which kills some of the nutrients but is better than some brands that can kill it all. For the price it's a good quality and taste.
reviews.review_header: I love this! It Is alittle sugary and tart

reviews.review_text: I am currently battling a potassium deficiency problem and in the past year have drank a ton of V-8 for the high potassium. At first I didn't mind this because I love Bloody Mary's but after 9 months I can barely get a small can of V-8 down and I am not a big fan of banannas. I saw this add on Facebook for Coconut Water and saw that it has the same amount of potassium as V-8. I bought a pack and have been drinking it for about a week. According the the reviews the pineapple seemed to be a big hit so I went with that. It tastes exactly like you would imagine a mixture of coconut and pineapple. I can't say I'm in love with it but it is 100% better than choking down the V-8. I have actually drank this every night after my workout for the hydration and potassium benefits. I will probably re-order as I haven't been able to find this in the local stores.

I tried the lemonade style and and it just doesn't do it. It needs sugar -- it just tastes like a sour lemon squeezed into coconut water, which I could make at home for a lot less money. In fact, I think I will! Edit: i realized I do not like drinking out of these paper-type containers. When i finally poured the liquid into a glass, and over ice, it tasted much better. I'll bump it up to 4 stars from 3.
reviews.review_header: not as good as it sounds; better over ice

reviews.review_text: If you love coconut water, you'll love this flavor! Super refreshing and hydrating. The flavor is delicious and I like it much better than just plain coconut water. The flavor tastes natural and doesn't taste artificial at all. I would definitely buy again.

reviews.review_text: After two rounds of chemo, my system was shot. Couldn't keep sodium and potassium levels up, nor prescribed supplements and meds down. Found SmartWater and it was helpful, but missed things that tasted good (which, buy the way, also help to incourage an appetite). There are now many types of coconut water on the market these days, and of the many brands and flavors available, Vita Coco Coconut Water with Pineapple, 11.1-Ounce Tetra Paks (Pack of 12) is by far my favorite. Buying bulk also gets the most for my money. This size fits easily in purse or car glovebox (though I like it best chilled).

The fruit flavor is so overpowering that it tastes artificial with a chemical aftertaste. I cannot drink it. I had a case of twelve and, rather than waste it, I tried it watered down in a smoothie. It was awful. I could not even drink it. I wish I could give it negative 100 stars.

And when you're hot and thirsty, absolutely nothing makes you feel hydrated again faster or better than coconut water. But this... THIS... Pineapple? OMG and holy-crap this stuff is good. I mean seriously good. We have 2 cartons of regular coconut water in the fridge that no one will drink because we like this so much better! My husband drank it for the first time and asked, "Why have we not always had this? Where were you keeping it for years?" (it was funny) So if you like coconut water, or if you just like drinking, get this. Drink this. It is just the best thing... and I bet it would be good with vodka too!!!!

I used to buy cases of Gatorade for my boys during their sport seasons, until I read about the ingredients in those types of products. Last track season, I stopped off at the Whole Foods store before hurrying to my son's district track meet. I grabbed him some ProBars and a couple bottles of VitaCoco Pure Coconut Water. When I handed them to him, he looked at me like I had gone nuts, but what he said to me after his event sold me forever. He said, "Mom, I felt better during this race than I ever have before! I felt like I was flying, with energy to spare! I could run it all over again!" I've decided to keep healthy fruit and nut based protein bars and coconut water around from now on! I will admit, though, that neither of my sons actually "likes" the taste of it. They think it tastes funny, but I figure it's because of the sugary "electrolyte" drinks they've become accustomed to. Since I won't be buying that anymore, they'll either have to get used to this, or just drink water!

reviews.review_text: So I've been a fan of Coconut water for quite some time. Usually I switch between all the big name brands because they all taste about the same. I wanted to give Amazon a try since the price of S&S was cheaper than my local Whole Foods. Unfortunately, the first and second batches I received had the same issues. Even with the screw cap. They would be a hit or miss. Some would smell like rotten fish, others would be clear and be perfectly fine. I drink these on a daily basis, and after a week both my girlfriend and I got food poisoning that required both of us to go to the ER to be put on IV's. When I contacted Vita Coco support, I got the same run around that "We appreciate your feedback but there is nothing we can do about your shipment and you should contact the retailer." Thanks for standing behind your products Vita Coco. I had to contact Amazon support and they were able to refund me the amounts. I'm throwing all of these out and canceling my subscription.

My husband has been having issues with his gallbladder and this coconut water is the only thing he can drink that doesn't make him feel like his insides are rebelling. We started wiping out the local grocery stores of their stock, so he tried another brand (Coco Libre) which he did NOT like as much. They are NOT the same! Running to grocery stores all over town to get his Vita Coco fix was becoming a pain, so I thought I'd just have some delivered to my front door via Amazon. That was a great idea! Now hubby is hydrated and pain free with a coconut water that tastes delicious and I don't have to play Supermarket Sweep when I get off work! Win-win!

Wow, what an amazing drink! We purchased a sampling of all of their drinks and have been very pleased with how great we feel after drinking the various Vita Coconut drinks. We live in the South and need to hydrate all of the time, especially in the summer months. We have found that drinking one in the morning just gets our bodies up and running. They are not sugary and therefore initially not a "wow how great is this" kind of drink. They also are not a "yuck what's this"! They are all a subtle energizing pleasant drink. You can get crazy and have a bit of fun using them instead of Tonic or Soda water if you know what I mean. They also are full of potassium which seems to "cure" the morning after a bit of partying. We are totally hooked and will continue to purchase them on Amazon as we can't find them anywhere locally! TamieA

My mom still gives me some fresh coconut water in the U.S (she buys whole coconut, and extract water) but it is never enough since, I haven't really found green coconuts here (which have the most water). I was on the hunt of something that tastes like pure coconut water. I have tried Zico and tasted horrible for me. Then one day, I just took Vita coco off of Walmart shelf, was very thirsty, opened it and was pleasantly surprised that it so much tasted like real coconut water. I'm in love with this thing and am glad amazon is selling it's case. The pineapple mix tastes great too :)

I love this! The combination of the slight salt of the coconut water with the sweet smoothness of the peach and mango work very well. I can't comment on other reviewers not liking it warm, but I think it's delicious chilled and poured over ice.

reviews.review_header: This was a good deal through Subscribe and Save - less expensive than ...

reviews.review_text: I'm going to be brutally honest here and say: I hate coconut water. I mean, I really hate it. I've tried every kind out there, and none of them taste good to me. But I've read how healthy is it, how it helps naturally with electrolyte balance and all that, and being on diuretics for my heart, I am always low in electrolytes, even with taking supplements my doctor prescribes for me. So I decided to try this coconut water because it was flavored. I'll admit the flavor helps make it palatable, but I still don't really like it by itself. BUT I've learned that if I put it in a smoothie with fresh fruit and veggies or add it to a veggie or fruit juice, I don't really even notice it or it adds a nice sweetness that I don't mind. I've also frozen it as ice cubes and added it to smoothies that way, to make them slushy and cold. It works beautifully, adds a little flavor that regular ice cubes or water wouldn't, but still gives me all the good electrolytes I'm wanting! It's a perfect solution and the easy-open little packages are recyclable, so I pop them in our recycle bin when I'm done. Easy peasy and healthy!
reviews.review_header: Best of the Coconut Waters I've Tried

reviews.review_text: When I first tried this product I was honestly disappointed. I suspect like most people who try coconut water for the first time I expected a tropical cocktail. Is the coconut flavor strong? Not really. But then again this is coconut water, if you want a more in your face flavor then coconut milk is what you're after. Can you taste the pineapple? Yes, but its going to be a bright note mixed in with the mellowness of the coconut water. The best way to serve it is cold and shaken well. I stick it in the freezer until it gets slushy and then shake it hard. That way even when it starts to melt, you still have a chilled drink to sip on. As to the reviewer who said there where white bits floating in their product, I never drank from a clear container but the ingredients list does say coconut water, pineapple puree, coconut puree, and vitamin c. So the white bits can be attributed to one of those, if the expiration date is fine (and those are usually more than generous) and it doesn't smell/taste like something's rotten in Denmark than everything should be fine. It even says on the bottle that since its made from natural ingredients there may be a variation in color and taste. It did taste a bit salty when I drank my first bottle, but I don't think I shook it either. I don't think the drink is going to be for everybody, it took a couple of tries before it grew on me and the only reason I started was because I'm trying to cut out sugary drinks but not ready to drink mostly water.

This is fantastic product when it actually arrives and isn't already expired...My last two orders of multiple cases have both come a month beyond the best before date?!?! Seriously, what is up with not check the best before dates.
reviews.review_header: This is fantastic product when it actually arrives and isn't already expired

Ohhhh. This is soooo good! It's light and refreshing, like water with pineapple coconut flavor--like a weak pina colada without the liquor. It doesn't taste phony either. It tastes natural. Too good to be just flavored water. I had mine chilled. It is imported from Brazil. A plastic twist-off cap allows you to stick in a straw easily, without hammering the package to punch it through. A single package is about 6 inches high, with 3 inch diagonal square shape. One paper coated package contains 17 fluid ounces, marked as 2 servings. Per serving stats are 60 calories (so 120 calories total per package), 0 fat, 0 cholesterol, 30mg sodium, 515 mg potassium, 16g sugar, 4 % calcium, 4 % phosphorus, 180 % vitamin C, 8 % magnesium. Ingredients, as listed in order on package are: natural coconut water, pineapple puree, coconut puree, ascorbic acid (vitamin C). The package states it is 100 % natural, has more electrolytes than leading sports drinks with 15 times the potassium, and has more potassium than 2 bananas. So--- it is REALLY good, refreshing, healthy, easily packable, and easily openable. (It's ok. I can make up words. I work for the government.) I really like the high potassium content, too. (Note--I am NOT a doctor.) As the sweltering East Coast heat and humidity approaches, potassium helps with the fluid you lose. Whether you are on fluid pills, or working outside in the eat, or running and jogging for your health, or hiking, or your children are playing and running in the heat, it's a real good idea to keep those potassium levels up. Low potassium levels, as I understand it, can be harmful, leading to cramps in your legs or worse--maybe even making you pass out. Anyway, this is good and it sure tastes a lot better to me than Gatoraid (yuk). So, check it out, and read up on "potassium" before the heat gets here.

The Vita Coco Coconut Water has legions of followers because it really works - especially if you're pregnant and have diet restrictions. Our local hospital stocks huge quantities of this along with milk and no wonder, it's lower in sugar than most fruit juices and hydrates a lot better than Gatorade. The high potassium was a lifesaver during my pregnancy when I needed to stay hydrated and prevent leg cramps while on bedrest. As it's all natural, it didn't trigger nausea (my favorite is Pineapple because of their mild taste, but my husband prefers Vita Coco Coconut Water with Tangerine, 11.2-Ounce Tetra Paks (Pack of 12) because it's fresh-tasting and doesn't taste like coconut). The Vita Coco 100% Pure Coconut Water, 11.2-Ounce Containers (Pack of 12) is mild and low in sugar, was a staple for me when I was diagnosed with gestational diabetes and not allowed to have more than 15g of carbs per meal.
reviews.review_header: Great drink for pregnancy, helps prevent leg cramps

(Note--I am NOT a doctor.) As the sweltering East Coast heat and humidity approaches, potassium helps with the fluid you lose. Whether you are on fluid pills, or working outside in the eat, or running and jogging for your health, or hiking, or your children are playing and running in the heat, it's a real good idea to keep those potassium levels up. I searched the web to find out if they use preservatives and found out where they'd been sued a couple times over false marketing claims and that witnesses in the trials said "that the packaging used and preservatives in Vita Coco products degrade the nutritional contents" so it's pretty clear they use preservatives although the label doesn't mention it.

Now I am pregnant and enjoy the added potassium and hydration it gives.

I have been drinking coconut water for about two years. I use it primarily for my long runs during my race training (for 1/2 marathons a nd marathons) instead of synthetic electrolytes (i.e. gatorades et al, cliff shot blox, gu-s, etc.). They do not upset my stomach and have found this peach mango to be delicious (over the plain). This and the passion fruit are my favorites. Be careful when you are ordering however - I have ordered a couple of cases when they go on "special" and the expiration dates have been a lot sooner (i.e. 3 months out) then I could consume.

I grew up in Hawaii so yes, I know what real coconuts taste like. This has a light peach and mango flavor(made with real mango and peach puree) that is pretty nice. It is not overwhelming like the tangerine one. I still prefer plain coconut water.
reviews.review_header: Good for a flavored coconut water

reviews.review_text: I bought a bottle of this juice and the ingredients say it has Coconut water, pineapple puree, coconut puree & vitamin C. I sent a question through Amazon asking if the Pineapple puree had sugar added to it and the response I got was ""That was not pineapple purée in there , but I sure added sugar on juice". So - poor English aside there is added sugar in this drink that is not listed on the ingredients and supposedly there is not pineapple puree in there. Huh????? Bottom line: juice went in the garbage. Not a trusted source of cococnut water without sugar added as it says on their package.
I am prone to the ONE brand, this brand has a bad after taste
reviews.review_header: this brand has a bad after

reviews.review_text: I have never had coconut water before. If drank straight from the carton, it is kind of a bland taste, but I am going to use in my smoothie machine.

I say green taste in that this reminds me of fresh green veggies. The flavor is subtle and may take some getting used to, but I really love it. Much better for your health than sports drinks since this is natural.
reviews.review_header: Very subtle "green" taste. Excellent potassium source!

reviews.review_text: Everyone is complaining about the pulp, but I find that is my favorite part of the drink. In fact, I shake it up real hard to make sure that I get more pulp off the sides of the container. I guess everyone has a different opinion. I love this drink! I agree that it is too expesive here online. I calculated it to be about $1.83/tetra pk on Amazon, when I buy it for $1.51 each in my grocery store.

I tried both Vita Coco's pineapple and Naked's and I prefer Naked, even though I don't think either are truly refreshing or have a great fresh pineapple taste. I suggest buying plain, pure coconut water and putting chilled pineapple juice from Dole into it. It will be more refreshing and have less other additives.
reviews.review_header: Try Naked Pineapple Instead, or Make Your Own

reviews.review_text: Nutritious drink, but has a metallic after taste similar to Cold Eeze. If you don't mind that taste, then you'll love this product.
reviews.review_header: Good bag lunch alternative to juice or soda.

reviews.review_text: I absolutely love this stuff! I just picked some up at my liquor store and it is so good. I love that it is pure coconut water too. I love it :) I recommend it for anyone who loves tropical flavors.
I just think this stuff is delicious, the only problem is that its been out of stock everywhere for most of the summer!!!
reviews.review_header: Vita Coco Coconut Water with Pineapple

reviews.review_text: I have a new obsession with the Peach and Mango flavor of Vita Coco. Over a glass of ice this is the best drink ever and it's healthy! I promise if you try this product, you will not be disappointed.
Certainly more expensive than water but, far better than water for recovery from intense physical activity and much healthier than artificial sugar filled sports drinks, juices and sodas.
excellent hydration

Plain coconut water has an earthy taste that not everyone enjoys. However, the coconut puree and pineapple puree along with some evaporated cane juice work well with the natural coconut water to make a nice drink that is especially refreshing after a workout. For best flavor, the Vita Coco beverages should be chilled well.
Tasty product but has pulp in it so my daughter doesn't care for it. Will go back to Zico.
better than the plain one. my girls love it! it is really a heathly drink after doing some excise, or just have it for no reason
This is my favorite of all the coconut waters out there. It tastes like a piña colada! If you thought plain coconut water was bland, give this one a try to liven up your taste buds.
It is as close as you can get to the real thing. Plain is my favorite, but the pineapple is the best of the fruit flavors. Vita Coco website has all the available flavors to view.
Awesome, plain and simple! Fresh taste, natural and oh so refreshing. I adore this stuff.
These are so good! Makes great lower calorie smoothies! And it is refreshing.
Drink like in a coconet
Tastes great. This is my favorite flavor of coconut water.

This particular flavor of Vita Coco is too sweet for being useful as a thirst quencher. The mango and peach completely overpower the coconut water. I think the mango even overpowers the peach, but I cannot be certain as the flavor is very strong and sweet. It is not unpleasant, but not what I was expecting.
reviews.review_header: too sweet for use as a sport drink or hydration

reviews.review_text: Love these. Thanks
This is great juice at a great price. I would recommend. Great flavors and variety. Much better price than the regular market.
Awesome product.
Love this; good healthy drink
Fantastic

I am a new 'converted' coconut water consumer. I really do not like the taste of coconut, so I ordered the water with pineapple puree. It is a refreshing light taste of pineapple. I bought it for the elctrolytes in the coconut water as I get dehydrated easily. This is the best coconut water out. This is my new 'vice,' and I can definetly feel the difference in my body! Buy it; you'll love it.
reviews.review_header: Great tasting beverage that helps greatly with dehydration!

reviews.review_text: This product tastes terrible and it also tastes NOTHING like actual coconut water. Anyone who has ever lived in a country where Coconuts actually grow would be and IS utterly offended by this product. It seems that people will buy anything that is prepackaged and overly process as long as it claims to be all natural. Save yourself and your bodies by not eating/drinking "natural" foods bought in a package. The truth of the matter is that anything that is actually authentic has not been processed in factories and put on a shelf.
reviews.review_header: Does anyone know what REAL coconut water tastes llike?

reviews.review_text: The product its self is super hard to open. Tetra package is horrible. I needed a tool to remove the cap from 60% of them. I then had to open the seal with my finger,like a caprisun. Only it is like pucturing a veitnam tiger trap caprisun.
This is without a doubt the NASTIEST tasting stuff ever..... it was like drinking seawater!!!!Nothing tasted like mango and it surely doesn't taste like coconut water.

So, this product, aside from the cane juice (but that makes it taste sooo good) is fantastic. The problem here, however, is that the claim, here, that you can save money by buying in bulk doesn't seem to hold water (even by having the repeat orders) since at every store I have seen it it is around 1.60. Here they are telling you that you are getting a break (and then some by taking a buck off) but you are paying 1.75. Kind of a bummer that it is so deceptive but...product is GREAT! Buy it in the store and save money!
reviews.review_header: Low star count not for product but for buying online

reviews.review_text: This does not taste like coconut water. I tried this along with the vita coco coconut water (original). The original one is really good. The one with pine apple is too sweet and you are loosing the essence of coconut water. It doesn't taste like pineapple nor coconut water. We really loved the original. I would not recommend this and would not buy it.

I was deployed to Iraq last year with the US Marine Corps. My wife sent me some of these which I put into the mini fridge that my hut had. After a 12 hour combat resupply mission, coming back to the hut and having one of these made me feel almost human again. I actually started saving them for the hottest/longest days. The taste is a little different, if you are used to gatorade or coke, but it is nice. Drink it cold.
reviews.review_header: One of the best care package items EVER.

reviews.review_text: Great flavor and leaves me feeling hydrated.

Ingredients are good, and while some coconut water does not taste the best, this is probably my favorite out of all the flavors. It does taste a little more like lemonade that coconut water, but that does not mean it is watered down at all. Good flavor, not too sweet, and not the 'typical' coconut water taste. My kid likes them also.
I love this stuff. Ordered multiple times with no issues.
Love
reviews.review_header: Love that it was at my door

reviews.review_text: My husband and I LOVE this stuff. We love how quickly it absorbs into the body. It just feels so right, doesn't sit or have a weird after taste like most sport drinks. Our body loves this stuff just as much as we do...without all that fructose, sucrose, and whatchamacallit preservative additive stuff in so many products today. I love the plain coconut water as it has less calories and gives me the boost I need. Just check out the ingredient list...coconut water...that's it!!! Gee I sound like a commercial :-/. Anyway, the fact that it's low in calories and offers the potassium and electrolites we need just seals the deal for us. Oh the other thing I noticed when comparing products is vitacoco uses ACTUAL fruit puree unlike the other brand that uses fruit essence...what is fruit "essence" anyway??? And if you've never had coconut water, it doesn't taste like cococut meat. It's more earthy and subtle. And if you're squimish on taste and picky, I recommend my husband's favorite flavor, Pineapple. That one is coconut water with pineapple and coconut meat puree...it tastes like a refreshing PinaColda :-). He absolutely LOVES it...I do too, but it has a little more calories (110 cal) and a little fat (2.5g), whereas the plain coconut water has only 60cal and 0 fat, yes, zero :-). BTW, my husband is an avid runner who logs around 45+ miles a week and is always looking for a good drink to rehydrate and recoop after a long run. Since this stuff isn't cheap, around $1.50 a shot, he saves it for his longest runs and drinks nestle quick chocolate skim milk for his shorter runs...but the coconut water is by far his favorite treat. Besure to chill it before drinking...not very refreshing warm :-p. For the reviewer who didn't like it, feel free to send your case to us, we'll drink it :-).
Addictive!! Would recommend to any pineapple and coconut lovers!
reviews.review_header: This is delicious it tastes like a piña colada...but it's healthy!! I'm in love with this; it's so refreshing.

reviews.review_text: I admit this is quite tasty, but I don't like that all the sugar makes you even thirstier after you drink it. It's hard to be refreshing with so much sweetness. I find myself needing to drink water after. The taste is better than other coconut waters', but ones like Zico are a bit less sweet and closer to pure coconut water.
I actually mix it in with my daughters juice since it's low in artificial sugars and it's very high in Vitamin C. She likes it.

Vita Coco is the stuff of life, you not only get a ton of nutrients and electrolytes and potassium but taste as well! Pineapple is my definite favorite flavor but they're all good. If you're going to choose a coconut water you need to stick with Vita Coco, Zico is made from concentrate.

This is my favorite drink of the summer when I want something other than water and something more than plain coconut water. I like the taste/aftertaste sensation. It does not seem as sweet as pineapple juice, but it does contain cane juice so it is somewhat sweet. It's great chilled after a long hike or a strenuous workout.
All I can say is, Yuck!

I've tried other coconut waters and Vita Coco is the best. There flavors taste fantastic and it is a healthier alternative to sugary sports drinks. I was working 12 hour days in a hot building all summer and no issues with cramping when I drank one of these a day. The peach and mango is my favorite.
I Use 1/4 of this container in a turvis and I am drinking more water. Tastes great!
Although tolerable when room temperature, chilled Vita Coco Coconut Water with Pineapple with a sprig of mint is so much tastier and refreshing. Yum!
reviews.review_header: Packs a tasty and healthy punch
